>>61905096
This. You bought latest iPhone? You’re poor!

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61907649
>>61905249
he's almost right

61907660
BUY MUTUAL FUNDS

RICE AND BEANS

SELL THE KIDS

BETTER THAN I DESERVE

61907724
>>61905079
Putting your entire stack as 20% down to get a mortgage is dumb. If your assets cover the mortgage, it's also not debt. Dave is in the business of engagement though...he thanks you for spreading his aura.

61907745
>>61907724
I like what he preaches. I finally started to respect every dollar. I was in a rough spot with payday loan now that I’m out of it I started saving. He hates payday lenders so do I.

61907808
>>61905079
>retarded boomer gives incredibly dumb financial advice to other retarded boomers who somehow managed to be poor despite working in the single most prosperous time period in the history of the fucking world
Imagine being able to buy between 1 and 2 oz of .999 gold just by flipping burgers at McDonalds for a week. How did any of those faggots manage to fuck up their lives?

61907901
>>61905232
This wasn't the own you thought it was lol

61908024
>>61905079
>CASH ONLY
you mean your worthless papers that are spawned into existence through usury itself?

Nah thanks, I'll just keep making thousands churning credit cards. never once carried a balance or paid interest cause im not a retarded nigger. later boomer

61908034
>>61905088
How much debt you in bud? Don't be mad at Dave cuz he's old school.

61908045
>>61905232
No one ever got rich from credit card perks. I'm not arguing that interest-free debt is cool but don't act like credit cards are how you get wealthy.

61908654
>>61905079
Horrible advice. Buy with credit cards that offer rewards, then pay them off in full every month before due date. Im up to 40 dols in cashback rewards just using cards instead of my debit, then paying off the bill with money I was going to use to buy the stuff in the first place. Literal free money and my credit score has been soaring. Fuck wish id done this a decade ago.

61908821
>>61905079
People meme on Dave a lot but I don't think he's that bad, I just don't think Dave is really meant for people who can control their spending. If you even somewhat understand money and you have a healthy savings account, good 401k, and don't have a ton of debt you aren't his target audience. His target audience is people who -
>are 21-50 years old
>have a $1.5k a month car loan for 84 months
>buy Labubus and other weird shit
>can't control their spending
>have 5 credit cards
>have no savings or long term investments
>make $15 an hour

61908832
>>61908654
that's the thing though, these people CANNOT control their spending. That's why giving them credit cards is a bad idea and why he says not to get them. If you know how you use a credit card IE just use it like a debit card, don't finance expensive shit or max it out, then you're fine. You gotta remember the people who need his advice probably have like sub 600 credit and ridiculous interest rates.

61908860
>>61908832
Yea. Ive come to understand as I get older peoples choices are the prime factor in their situation and bad luck is just a cope they console themselves with.

61908878
>>61908821
This anon gets it.

61909951
>>61908821
his videos have like millions of views, I wonder if theres that many people who are bad with finances

61909964
>>61905079
shit i realized when i was sixteen for 500, Alex

61909987
>>61907808
There's always a cheap asset that's an "obvious buy" looking back, no one can predict the future.

Buy platinum.

61910179
shit, my earning didn't outpace inflation. I'm now worse off than i was due to asset prices increasing before i could buy.

61911929
I’ve opened my first savings account few days ago I already have $30 saved.

I’m literally taking baby steps

61911936
>>61905079
Good luck buying a home. Or a non-shitbox car. Credit is fake and gay but its sadly reality.

61911940
>every single day talking to retards who spend 1k+ a month on their pickup truck
>or women who think they should sign for loans because their boyfriend has bad credit

You'd simplify your lesson really fast too

61912125
>>61908045
The mindset counts for something. I've churned through a few dozen of the credit card bonuses. Practically speaking, it's pocket change in the grand scheme of things. But it's one of many financially health habits that allowed me to get rich and retire early.

61912248
>>61909951
young people are generally very bad with money. A lot of people don't start saving until they're like 30+. I think the average savings in the US for Gen Z workers is $1000. So yes, there's a lot of people who are horrible with money. Financial classes should be a requirement in high schools.

61912706
>>61905079
>SAY NO TO MORTGAGE
I thought a mortgage was the only form of debt that he's okay with

61913103
The only chain link you need is a FENCE to keep your dumbass from walking out into the freeway. Sell it all tonight if you can.

61913157
>>61905079
what a stupid shit. in my case it is clever look at it:

>been saving for years but still can't afford expensive house
>buy cheap flat with small mortage
>i pay off small mortage and keep saving a bit for next 10 years
>sell flat, earn money because of house market appreciation
>with old flat value + savings i can now afford expensive house

if i was alergic to even small mortages i would spend 10+ years depressed in a shithole until i save enough for big house. it makes no sense

61913202
I’d be digging ditches instead of working an email job if I listened to boomers like this. He advocates for the financial version of the keto diet, where you will lose weight but you really should’ve avoided soda (credit card debt) instead of avoiding brown rice (borrowing money to go to college and not dig ditches).

61913953
>>61905079
>SAY NO TO DEBT
>SAY NO TO MORTGAGE
You realize that's the exact opposite of baby boomer philosophy, right?

They openly encourage you to go into debt and get a mortgage and "work" at a shit job mother feasting out of buffet on another Hawaiian cruise vacation.

61914382
>>61905232
>im going to give all my private info to companies for $200 that sell it to advertisers for $25k
>n-no its you guys that are r-r-ret-t-t-tarded
>data breach? Thats the 5th on this week!
>look honey we got $0.48 in a class-action! We can put that towards $20k in damages they caused.
>my identity was flagged on a fake Cambodia passport?
>BUT HOW!?
nice airline miles faggot

61914474
>>61905096
I mean you jest but if you know better than Ramsey then you're not in a situation to need his advice.
>>61905079
Yeah but what are the best practices for retards? Like what would you tell near complete retards to do, with very very simple rules so they don't spend too much?

Mormons and other religions do this shit too.

>"No gambling EVER! You are not even allowed to look at a deck of cards!"
>"No drinking ever!!!'

And a rational person could say "oh yes but I'm just going to have this deck of cards to amuse myself when friends come over with no real money. Oh I'm just going to have a nice glass of wine with my steak" and stick to it. But a good chunk of the population are fucking retards and so telling them absolutely not even a drop of booze or else Jesus will cry is good advice, given the number of people who end up dead or killing people or fucking shit up because they're alcoholics.

Tldr; read all of those instructions you don't like as "hey retards,..." And then it'll make sense and you won't complain
